author: rooneg
msg: Begin the introduction of a client context object into libsvn_client.  This
will eventually hold various client specific callbacks and batons that need
to be specified for each invocation of the client API.  At the moment, it
just holds the svn_client_auth_baton_t, and is only passed to the functions
that used to take svn_client_auth_baton_t's as parameters.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/*-cmd.c
create svn_client_ctx_t objects to hold our authentication batons and pass
them into the underlying libsvn_client functions we are calling.
* subversion/include/svn_client.h
(svn_client_ctx_t): new object representing the 'client context'.
(svn_client_ctx_create): function to create a context object.
(svn_client_ctx_set_auth_baton, svn_client_ctx_get_auth_baton): getter and
setter functions for holding an authentication baton inside a context.
(svn_client_checkout, svn_client_update, svn_client_switch,
svn_client_mkdir, svn_client_delete, svn_client_import, svn_client_commit,
svn_client_status, svn_client_log, svn_client_diff, svn_client_merge,
svn_client_copy, svn_client_move, svn_client_revprop_set,
svn_client_propget, svn_client_revprop_get, svn_client_proplist,
svn_client_revprop_list, svn_client_export, svn_client_ls,
svn_client_cat): switch from passing bare authentication batons over to
svn_client_ctx_t's that hold authentication batons, and update the docs to
account for this.
* subversion/include/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_CLIENT_CTX_NOT_FOUND): new error for when a requested parameter is
not found in the client context.
* subversion/libsvn_client/add.c
(svn_client_mkdir); take a context instead of an auth baton, grab the
auth baton from it when we need it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/cat.c
(svn_client_cat): take an svn_client_ctx_t instead of an auth baton, and
get the auth baton out of it when we need it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/checkout.c
(svn_client_checkout): take a context instead of an auth_baton, and grab the
auth_baton from it when we need it.  pass the context into
svn_client__handle_externals.
* subversion/libsvn_client/client.h
(svn_client__handle_externals): update prototype for new parameter.
* subversion/libsvn_client/commit.c
(svn_client_import): take a context instead of an auth baton, grab the
auth baton from it when we need it.
(svn_client_commit): ditto.
* subversion/libsvn_client/context.c
new file, holds implementation of svn_client_ctx_*.
* subversion/libsvn_client/copy.c
(setup_copy): take a context instead of an auth baton, grab the auth
baton out of it when we need it.
(svn_client_copy): take a context instead of an auth baton and pass it to
setup_copy.
(svn_client_move): ditto.
* subversion/libsvn_client/delete.c
(svn_client_delete): take a context instead of an authentication baton,
and get the authentication baton out of it when we need it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(merge_cmd_baton): change the auth_baton member to a context.
(merge_file_added): pass the context in the merge baton into svn_client_copy.
(merge_dir_added): ditto.
(do_merge): take a context instead of an auth baton, and grab the auth baton
from it when we need it.
(do_single_file_merge): ditto.
(do_diff): ditto.
(svn_client_diff): take a context instead of an auth baton, pass it  into
do_diff.
(svn_client_merge): take a context instead of an auth baton, pass it into
do_single_file_merge or do_merge.
* subversion/libsvn_client/export.c
(svn_client_export): take a context instead of an auth_baton, and grab the
auth_baton from it when we need it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/externals.c
(svn_client__handle_externals): take a context instead of an auth_baton.
(handle_items_change_baton, handle_externals_desc_changed_baton): hold a
context instead of an auth_baton.
(all others): update calls to svn_client_update and svn_client_checkout to
pass context instead of auth_baton.
* subversion/libsvn_client/log.c
(svn_client_log): take a context instead of an auth baton, grab the
auth baton when we need it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/ls.c
(svn_client_ls): take a context instead of an auth baton, grab the auth baton
when we need it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/prop_commands.c
(svn_client_revprop_set, svn_client_propget, svn_client_revprop_get,
svn_client_proplist, svn_client_revprop_list): take svn_client_ctx_t's
instead of auth_baton's, and grab the auth baton out of it when we need it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/status.c
(svn_client_status): take a context instead of an auth baton, grab the auth
baton from it when we need it.
* subversion/libsvn_client/switch.c
(svn_client_switch): take an svn_client_ctx_t instead of an auth_baton, and
grab the auth_baton out of it when we need it.  pass the context in to
svn_client__handle_externals.
* subversion/libsvn_client/update.c
(svn_client_update): take a context instead of an auth_baton, and grab the
auth_baton out of it when we need it.  pass the context in to
svn_client__handle_externals.
* subversion/svnversion/main.c
(main): create and pass a context into svn_client_status.
This is an empty revision for padding.

author: philip
msg: Add a new fs test to check the CopyID of newly created items in a
copied directory.  Bill tells me it reveals an fs bug, so it's
currently an XFAIL.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_fs/fs-test.c
(create_within_copy): New test.
(test_funcs): XFAIL create_within_copy.
This is an empty revision for padding.
This is an empty revision for padding.
